articles.title: Monkeypox Found In Europe, Us: Know About Transmission, Symptoms; Should You Be Worried? | Mint - Mint
articles.description: Monkeypox is a virus that causes fever symptoms as well as a distinctive bumpy rash. It was first discovered in 1958 in monkeys kept for research — hence the name — with the first human case recorded in 1970
articles.content:
The United States has reported a new case of the rare and potentially dangerous monkeypox, while two news cases have appeared in the United Kingdom.

articles.author: Rohan Smith
articles.title: ‘It is serious’: Monkeypox virus spreading - news.com.au
articles.description: Australian health authorities are concerned that the rare but potentially serious monkeypox virus could reach Australia as cases are detected in the UK, the US, Canada and Europe.

articles.title: Asian markets tumble after a tough day on Wall Street - CNN

articles.title: Over 40 New Monkeypox Cases Have Been Detected in Europe, Health Officials Report - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Spain and Portugal have detected over 40 suspected cases of monkeypox, a viral infection rarely seen in Europe, with both outbreaks concentrated in the Madrid and Lisbon areas, officials said Wednesday.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Ukraine troops begin to surrender in Mariupol - Moneycontrol
articles.description: Ukraine's military said it aimed to evacuate its remaining soldiers from their last stronghold in Mariupol, as fighters that have held out for 82 days began to surrender, heralding the end of Europe's bloodiest battle in decades.
